data.event: The area was first called Peterborough Slip, which included what is now Sharon.

event.title: 1758, Maj. Ephraim Heald and his wife Sarah, moved

data.event: In 1758, Maj. Ephraim Heald and his wife Sarah, moved to Temple, They, along with his brother, Dea.
In 1768, it was incorporated by colonial Governor John Wentworth, who named it after his lieutenant governor, John Temple.
Temple Glassworks was founded here in 1780 by Robert Hewes of Boston.
